content: Damascus and Samaria Fall
Then the  said to me, “Take for yourself a large tablet [for public display] and write on it in ordinary characters:  to Maher-shalal-hash-baz.
And I will get faithful witnesses to attest [to this prophecy] for me, Uriah the priest and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah.”
So I approached [my wife] the prophetess, and she conceived and gave birth to a son. Then the  said to me, “Name him Maher-shalal-hash-baz [to remind the people of the prophecy];
for before the boy knows how to say, ‘My father’ or ‘My mother,’ the riches of Damascus (Aram’s capital) and the spoil of Samaria (Israel’s capital) will be carried away by the king of Assyria.”
Again the  spoke to me, saying,
A Believing Remnant
“Be broken [in pieces], O peoples, and be shattered!
Listen, all you [our enemies from the] far countries.
Prepare yourselves [for war], and be shattered;
Prepare yourselves [for war], and be shattered.
“Take counsel together [against Judah], but it will come to nothing;
Speak the word, but it will not stand,
For God is with us (Immanuel).”
For in this way the  spoke to me with His strong hand [upon me] and instructed me not to walk in the way of this people [behaving as they do], saying,
Bind up the testimony, seal the law  the teaching among my (Isaiah’s) disciples.
And I will wait for the  who is hiding His face from the house of Jacob; and I will look eagerly for Him.
Listen carefully, I and the children whom the  has given me are for signs and wonders [that will occur] in Israel from the  of hosts, who dwells on Mount Zion.

When the people [instead of trusting God] say to you, “Consult the mediums [who try to talk to the dead] and the soothsayers who chirp  whisper and mutter,” should not a people consult their God?  the dead on behalf of the living?
[Direct those people] to the law and to the testimony! If their teachings are not in accord with this word, it is because they have no dawn.

They [who consult mediums and soothsayers] will pass through the land deeply distressed and hungry, and when they are hungry, they will become enraged and will curse their king and their God as they look upward.
Then they will look to the earth, they will see only distress and darkness, the gloom of anguish; and  driven away into darkness  overwhelming night.
